New Records: Luka Doncic scored 25 first-half points, including five three-pointers
Key Match Events: Dallas maintained their momentum in the second half and stretched their advantage to 82-52 on Doncic's free throw with six minutes and five seconds to play in the third quarter
Orlando made just eight of 41 three-point attempts
Pre-Game Insights: There is no information about pre-game insights in this article
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Doncic said 'Today was real fun,' he said. 'We were guarding everybody, defending, rebounding, playing with a lot of pace. So that's fun for me.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Detroit Pistons bounced back from a 30-point loss to the New York Knicks on Friday to claim their second victory of the season with a 106-92 success against the Brooklyn Nets

In New Orleans, Jalen Johnson scored 29 points and Trae Young added 23 points, four rebounds, 12 assists and a steal as the Atlanta Hawks won 126-111 to hand the injury-hit Pelicans their first home defeat of the season
Others: Paolo Banchero, Orlando's All-Star forward, has an abdominal muscle injury and is set to miss at least the next four weeks
